comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The New York Sun., September 08, 1915, Page 3 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030272/1915-09-08/ed-... reports, "$80,000,000 TREASURE COMES FROM ENGLAND Hundred Guards Watch Gold All Night at Express Company's Terminal --- Will Be Moved to Downtown Depositary Early This Morning. The treasure train from Halifax. carrying Great Britain's third shipment of gold to this country, slipped into New York last night under cover of darkness. ... this morning twenty-five automobile trucks of the American Express Company will take the gold from the Grand Central station to the sub-Treasury."
